Description: Fragment with rim of an Egyptian(izing) glazed composition 'common bowl'; mould-made or -pressed, covered with a green-blue glaze and decorated with black/drk brown paint; the remains of a lotus leaf motif are visible; fragment made up from eight small sherds; original diameter of bowl approximately 9 cm.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hala Sultan Tekke, Tomb II
Curator's comments: See E. Peltenburg, 'Hathor, faience and copper on Late Bonrze Age Cyprus', CCEC 37 (2007), 375-394 on the Egyptian 'common bowl' on Cyprus.
Bibliographic references: Bailey 1976 / Hala Sultan Tekke I. Excavations 1897-1971 (p. 10, pl.IVa, b)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 182)
